titleStmt.title: Edition of Cambridge, St. John's College, MS 191 G.23 ff. 164v-167r "Documenta matris ad filiam"
titleStmt.author: J. de Ramsey Capellani

publicationStmt.p: By permission of the Master and Fellows of St John's College, Cambridge. A critical printed edition of Documenta matris ad filiam can be found in Ratis Raving: And Other Early Scots Poems on Morals, 1939, by Ritchie Girvan printed for the Society by W. Blackwood and Sons. The text is printed on the odd-numbered pages 82-99.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Scots, with Latin incipit and explicit for each text.

msItem.title: Barbour's Bruce
msItem.author: J de R Capellani
msItem.explicit: Expl. liber excellentissimi et nobilissimi principis roberti de broyss scottorum regis illustrissimi qui quidem liber scriptus fuit et finitus in vigilia sancti Johannis baptiste viz. decollacio eiusdem per manum J. de R capellani a.d. Millesimo quadringentesimo octogesimo septimo.

msItem.title: Documenta matris ad filiam
msItem.explicit: Explicit Documentum matris ad filiam per Manum J de R capellani
msItem.author: J de R Capellani

msItem.title: Scotticized version of John Lydgate’s Dietary
msItem.explicit: Expl. documentum ualde utile quod J. to yow…
msItem.author: J de R Capellani

supportDesc.extent:
143 leaves, of which the first 25 are missing.
21 15

layout.p: Text is written in a single column per paper leaf, with 42-25 lines to each page.

handNote.p: According to St. John's College Library webpage, the manuscript is entirely written by J. de Ramsay. This is also confirmed in the endings of the first two contents, stating that they were written by "J. de R. Capellani". The hand is described as "ugly current" and has the looks of a mixture between Anglicana and Secretary.

decoDesc.p: In Documenta matris ad filiam the incipit and explicit are underlined in red ink. The first word of the text is made of capitals decorated with red strokes. The initials of the first of f. 164r ll. 1-8, f. 164v l. 39 and f. 166v l. 21 are decorated with a red stroke. In the right margin of 167v is a vertical line made of red dots. Fols 164v, 165r, 167v contain marginalia deemed of no linguistic nor content relevance, therefore treated as purely decorative.

titlePage.titlePart: Edition of Cambridge, St. John's College, MS 191 G.23 "Documenta matris ad filiam"

div.p: By permission of the Master and Fellows of St John's College, Cambridge. Documenta matris ad filiam is part of a tradition of conduct literature on the subject of rules and behaviours to follow in late-15th century English and Scottish society.

monogr.title: The good wife taught her daughter; The good wife wold a pylgremage; The thewis of gud women

div.l:
Incipiut Incipiunt
documeta documenta
mis matis
ad
filia filiam
E gud wiff chawi e bet cho can,

Quhilk ar the thewi of a gud
voma voman ,

Quhilk
ger geris
wome women
be haldin deir

And
mak makes
pou pouer
women pinci peir,
With um ill techi and Ill thewi
at followi foull women chewi.
A to e fit men uld conyder

That
womai womani
honor i mair lyder,
And eythar blekyt be mekill thing

A faet
o oe
oyne
tak takis
fadyng.

A
woma woman
uld haue
eu euir
addour

Of thing at geif
mytht mycht
hir honour,
With pite and humilite
and litill of Langage for to be,

No Nocht
Lowd of
lauthtir lauchtir
na of langage
cou coue ,

And
eu euir
do um gud to the
hou houe
.

No Nocht
oy oye
of tatlyng in e
toune toune

Na with men for to owk
owne owne
Suet and hamly empill and coy

With feneit fair
notht nocht
mak our moy

No Nocht
nye poude na our delicat
Na contefet our get etat
avour na dei of dihonour
kep vochip till all ceatour

Be
no nocht
leull lefull
tatlyng tatlyngis
till heir

Na till
ehe ehee
quha vald
ai aim
peir

Till hir
fend fendis
obeiand be
In gudly thing at may upple

Notht Nocht
delicat in hir clething
Bot playn maneir and gudly thing

No Nocht
our cotlik na it
umptuou umptuoue

To mak folk at hir
Invyou Invyoue

Na covat
no Nocht
clething mair deir

Na be
eoue eoune
hir tat uld feir
And ouch cho be cled peciouly

Couat Covat
notht nocht
to be eyn for i
Quhen cho i poude to chaw hir an

I taknyng of
ane ane
euill
Woma Woman
Q T Bot quhen it aw with eon to be
To chaw hir an i honete
With uet gud ownd contynan

Notht Nocht
our fer
pe pee
hir till avan
Till chaw hir py at men may e
at i bot pomp and vanite

Bot
eu euir
with deid and chamfulne

Scho uld draw to e Lawat
pla plae
And erar lawar place to tak
Na hear and be put abak
God doi honour till Lawlyna

Quhen py i pwnyt in all
pla plae

Quhilk in women i mair to
blame blame

fo
eft eftir
pyd oft followi
chame chame

Notht Nocht
an ai uld be honet ay

Eft Eftir
air etat ilk day

And hear honour
bett bettir
thing
And lawar tat lakar clething

for pyd gai no thing be e
clai claie

Bot be e het at
woma woman
ha hae
for um will be a toutly cled
Or ai will crab ar men in bed

at half e
iche ichee
at he
ha hae

Sall cant be woth hi
viff viffis
cla clae
an quhen ai cle ar our tatly
Men will peoyme na gud teuly
Bot at cho doi it for paramourt
And u gat faid all hir honour
afor e bet thing i I wat

I to be cled
eft eftir
air etat

Kepe ame
fadelit fa delit
no nocht
vaiabill
vel
vakable vakabile

And fa all dedi
dihonabill dihonorabill

Notht Nocht
fa e deid all anely
Bot fa all that i Ill likly
le ill folk and upekit place
Get lak followi of Ill liklynace

fo
eu euir
dihonoit Cumpany
adi all honour Comonly
Dant nocht madeny our vantonly

Na feyd ame
notht nocht
Deliciouly

AA AA A A AAA AA fo meti and dynki
deliciou delicioue
Drawi to lichey men ayi us

Nalet Na let
ame
notht nocht
ga to ar will
bot it weill uddane be air till

Na to clek playi na
pilgmage prilgrimage

Bot ar be vith
ai aim
vi vie
folk of age

Thoill
ai aim
no nocht
thoi age with ybaldy

Na mengill ame with
neu neuir
vith lady

Nou Nouir
nytht nycht
norday nor day
to hant allane

That ha beyn ded of mony
ane ane

all be ai
neu neuir
o yb no
tend tendir

for nakit lying lufent will
gend gendir

faai fa ai
be pait evin eir and mair

Natur pyngi and will
notht nocht
pair

Suppo Suppoe
no man will ame mytat

e lang acquyntan will
no nocht
let
Vith fo of natue and utelte

Ofe Of e
fal fend at i o lee
Dawi ic pleand acquyntan
Thou outhede and thou ignoans

And outhede
canno can no
peel peellis
cat
Quhill at all be peit at e lat
Than had I wittyn will ai ay
With mony alla and hameay
an war it bettir foee the Ill
O ic myfotoun fall ame till
for a men edi in ald toys

Ten thouand tynt ar on thi
vi vie

Of
it itir
and
be beir
in ic lik
ca cae

That banyt yne fra fendi
wa wae

In tange ewmy fled for
chame chame

at dut
neu neuir
eft eftir
be eyne at hame
kepe ame fa gifti to gif or craff

Or billi of
Amow Amowis
till eaff

O eit
tilldan till dane
in to e yng
Na oppinly in the ew to yng
Na yn at bae in the vay
bot hald air Inny gif ai vill play

Oy Oye
nou nouir
flyting tut no tiff

Pe Pee
no nocht
to geiff
nou nouir
man na viff

In thift tif ay with hir
nythtbour nychtbour
Quha bet can thif bot dihonour

Pe Pee
notht nocht
in fet to yt our hye

Na
eue euire
day in lik powd be
Na our cleyn vechyn on vek dayis
Na on e vek day gang to playis

flawm
no nocht
na
flui fluie
at vill fade
To mend e mak at god ha made

Vith paynteyn
vatti vattiri
to ger hir
cheyne cheyne

On haly dayi hir hyde hald
cleyne cleyne

Notht Nocht
with
colou colouis
na vith pante
for ic thing i bot geglotye
Schaym i to day be quhit and ede
and vallowit on e mon a lede
Bot kep e hew of hir natur
for ic faine all langat dur
kep bydding ay and lyf clenly
Thank god and luf him ythandly

Be
eu euir of
pur pure folk pyteabill

Do
alm almus
deid be cheitabill
Gif nane Ill wod behynd ar bak

And loyf all leid and no
ma man lak
And gif cho be in goddi band
Be leil and tew till hir huband

And
gaciou gacioue
ay till hir menhe
kepand in houhald honete
Till all folk uet and debonar
With gudly deid at hir power
Be feme of hed bath fut and hand

Notht Nocht
oft in to e tete vaverand

for vaveryng
betakyni betakynni
viluna vilumna
Vanvit velth or wantowna
Or elli to ek um Cumpany

Quhilk war
no nocht
lik to be gudly

Bot
eu euir
hald owme and playn maneir

Eu Euir
hald hir fallowchip till hir feir
le fa diffamyt Cumpany

likdawi lik dawi
till lik ay Comonly

luf
no nocht
get leping na eit ueirna

for mekill Ill
cumy cummy
of ydilna

No Nocht
leif to
vantoune vantoune
gigloti giglotie

kepe fei of women at ar
vi vie

And
eu euir
confome hir to e bet
Of vomen at ar vothyet

Do na thing at
likIll lik Ill
may be

Gif na
occaione occaione
for till le
for quhen cho doi at i lik Ill

Tat
no nocht
at folk Will hald
ai aim
till

oth
itbe it be
neu neuir
o ecetly

Tat weill it bei
no nocht
hyd for i

Suppo Suppoe
cho heir of it na thing

folk will
notht nocht
leiff of ar demyng

hant
notht nocht
vith vith
men our anerly

all
outh ouch
ai be
neu neuir
a vothy

Na gang
notht nocht
allane hir
erand erand
Tak child or madyn in hir hand
It i na poynt of honete
A gud woman allane to be

In cumpany of mony
ane ane

And mekill le of
ane ane
allane allane

Trat weill it i
ane ane
euill cutum
for na folk will e gud peum
and quhen cho pai hir erand

Byde
notht nocht
apon it lang dremand

Na yt
notht nocht
doune to hald talkyng
Quhill cho foet hir hame ganging

Think quhat cho ha
tilldo till do
at hayme

And
eu euir
be dredand till haue
blayme blayme

Voma Voman
at ha
ane ane
vantoune vantoune
het

Ane Ane
hour or twa
think thinkis
bot
ane ane
tet

Gif men
ame ame
withgang wantonly
Syne will ai couat e maty
ar i no thyng ai couat mair

Na
fedome fedome
fawyng and gud fair

Na ai vald
neu neuir
epeuit be

Na eit coekit in
nadege na dege

ai uld kep laute with all
my mycht

And mat quhar ai haf laute
hy hycht

hate
no nocht
but get
cau caue
manifet

e fit luf
eu euir
be lufit bet

at cho ewe
notht nocht
to haue epuf
for vnlaute to fofet luff
and vyn lufent of hir mene

fa
dukyn dunkyn
folk and tavene fle
Be of gud payer quhen cho may

and heir
me mee
on e haly day

fo mekill gace
cui cumi
of paying

and
bing bingis
men ay to gud ending
and in e kik kepe our all thing
fa myking keking and bakluking

And
eft eftir
noyne on e haly day

Ow Owir
pay of pot at honet play

But leif et
notht nocht
i het to luff

for
eft eftir
followi get epuff
leiff i awn will and tak conale
Or it all tun e to tynale

Tayt
no nocht
with men na mak aging

for oft it
tak takis
ane ane
foull ending

It i
ane ane
takyn of foull women
To tyg and tayt oft with e men

Be Be
no nocht
lefull
chag chagis
to tak
Na erand ber na meage mak
for ai condicione ar of bany

At eyn
notht nocht
ei het
no nocht
any
afor women uld kepit be

That ai
mytht mycht
na
litht licht
wome women
e

Suppo Suppoe
it war agane air will
It avi ame mony a tym fa Ill
for foull women ar a mytabill
and till all vikit wyci abill

That
eu euir
the Cumpany quhar ai tak

Sall
neu neuir
chap forouten lak
Men byndi oft folk agane ar will

Quhill um get cue be
done done
ai aim
till

Quhilk war
no nocht
fo ai wald
no nocht
do it
And eit it tuny to mekill gude
Thu our all thing a air aid I
kepe ame fa cancyt Cumpany
for quha Diffamyt i or wik
Vald all e layff war to ame lik
Quha myttit War wald all var wa

And
landit landerit
folk vald
eu euir
haue haue
ma

bot tak ampill ay by hir
nythtbour nychtbour

gif
eu euir
cho
think thinkis
to haff honour

Gif
madyni madynni
eu euir
gud teching
and doctyne ame quhill ai ar ing
In keping with a gud mate

Quhill
keni kenni
vetue mair and le
And chaty ame quhill ai ar child
Quhill vidome cum thou vit in eld

for outhede
eu euir
enclyni to vice

for eilden fynde we bany
vi vie

ow may in outhede
ty tye
a cheld
That for na gold wald do it in eld

or i oung
lod lodis
ar put in cue

Quhill vidome cum
ai aim
be natue
for falt of aw and of teching

Byngi ame oft to
mygounyng mygouernyng
Quhilk and ai had in air outhage
Quhill ai of vidome had knawlage

And chaty ame quhen
aido ai do
my mye

Our ekle
thoula thoulae
wantoun i
ai uld be chat and cheitabill

Wothy women
wi wie
and abill

and
eft eftir
cum to get valour
And do air fendi get honour

And quhen ai get nane
intuctione intuctione

Na for mydeid na
pwnycioune pwnycioune
Bot letti ame follow air vantowne

And
favou favouis
ame in air vikkidne
Of all ar Ill ai haue e vit
And do ai weill e mat meit

for oftyme
fend fendis
a men edi

Ar dampnit for ar bani
ded dedis
Quha will kep bath fa peiching
Tak tent and kep wele i teching

And pwny ame quhen
aido ai do
my mye

And
ekle eklee
or our wantoun i

And let ame
no nocht
haf all ar will
Bot chaty ame quhen ai do Ill

Bettir i with chatyment
ame ame
mend
Na aull and liff bath tak Ill end
i And kep ame fa neyd and mytair

That pouerte gar ame
no nocht
myfair

for
poute pouerte
mak makis
mony Ill woman

Quhilk Quhilkis
and ai had a thifty man
With gudly ufficiand lyffing

ai wald
neu neuir
fofalt for na thing
for oft tyme vechit neidliking

Sic
myti myteri
hald haldis
madyni madynni
In
That ai ar pynit with pouerte

Quhilk get neid
ge geis
ar
het hetis
de

And may
no nocht
for air vechitne

Get
couati couatie
and gedyne

Put ame in outhed to
fit profit
Thu of ar Ill ai haf e vit
And all e chage haill of ar yn

That neid and
poute pouerte
putti
ai aim
In

Bath
plithtand plicht and
peell on
ai aim
lyi

That tyni ar bany on i
wi wie
ai haue no craft how uld ai liff
Quhen fendi will ame na thing gif

Than i ar
notht nocht
bot do or de
On neyd u mon ai fuli be

And yne quhen ai haf tane
afall a fall

an way ai air
fend fendis
all

And putti ame out of
godd goddis
gace

Thu bath ar tynt thou
vikkidna vikkidnae

Explicit documentum
mis matris
ad filiam

per
Manu Manum
J de R
cap capellani
